page.title: 09LEISURE ACTIVITIES
page.content: {LEISURE ACTIVITIES DUNSMORE {Coombe Hill as a Centre of Recreation Coombe Hill is a popular venue for walkers and many footpaths criss_cross its summit. At holiday time and at weekends many families use it as a picnic area and is a favourite spot to exercise their dogs.As the highest point in the Chilterns it is a splendid spot for kite flying and is the HQ. of a model Aeroplane club. This is the Coombe Hill Soaring Association. In winter snow, the hill is alive with sledgers and skiers as the steep slopes give exellent sport. Below the summit in the hamlet of Coombe, the former school buildings are the property of the Girl Guide Association.Guides and Brownie packs of the district use it for camping and instuctional weekends. There is enough space for the traditional camp fire.
